intro: Arachnites oxyrhynchus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water plantain, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that often float on the water surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically emerging from the water. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats and is often found in marshes and pond margins. Arachnites oxyrhynchus plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and waterfowl.
